1.q_string: A reaction, \(A+B \rightarrow C+D+q\) is found to have a positive entropy change. The reaction will be:

A gas is compressed at constant pressure from \(0.3 \mathrm{~m}^{3}\) and \(0.1 \mathrm{MPa}\) to \(0.15 \mathrm{~m}^{3}\). There is a transfer of heat of \(35 \mathrm{~kJ}\) from gas during the process. Find the change in internal energy during the process.
The direction of a natural process is dictated by the __________ law of thermodynamics.
If __________ between the system and the surroundings, the process is adiabatic.
q_option: heat flows but matter does not flow
matter flows but heat does not flow

What is the enthalpy change for the given reaction, if enthalpies of formation of \({Al}_{2} {O}_{3}\) and \({Fe}_{2} {O}_{3}\) are \(-1670 {~k} {J} {~mol}^{-1}\) and \(-834 {~kJ} {~mol}^{-1}\) respectively. 

\({Fe}_{2} {O}_{3}+2 {Al} \rightarrow {Al}_{2} {O}_{3}+2 {Fe}\)
According to the first law of thermodynamics, \(\Delta U=q+w\). In special cases the statement can be expressed in different ways. Which of the following is not a correct expression?
q_option: When work is done by the system: \(\Delta U=q+w\)
